com.illcode.hl7

Class HL7Params

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.illcode.hl7.HL7Params

  • public final class HL7Params
extends java.lang.Object
    An instance of HL7Params stores the settings used to encode/decode HL7v2 messages. These are, basically, the field separator, encoding characters, and character set found in the MSH segment.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      char componentSeparator 
      char escapeChar 
      char fieldSeparator 
      char[] fieldValueSeparators
      An array of the separators in "descending" order of a parse tree for field data:
      i.e.
      char repetitionSeparator 
      char subcomponentSeparator 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HL7Params()
      Construct an HL7Params using the default separators and escape character.
      HL7Params(char fieldSeparator, char componentSeparator, char subcomponentSeparator, char repetitionSeparator, char escapeChar)
      Construct an HL7Params using the given separators and escape character.
      HL7Params(java.lang.String MSHText)
      Construct an HL7Params using the separators and escape character found in the MSH segment text given as an argument.

    • Method Summary

      Methods

      • fieldValueSeparators

        public char[] fieldValueSeparators
        An array of the separators in "descending" order of a parse tree for field data:
        i.e. [repetitionSeparator, componentSeparator, subcomponentSeparator]

    • Method Detail

      • escape

        public java.lang.String escape(java.lang.String s)
        Escapes text given the separators and escape character in this HL7Params instance.

        For instance, given the default HL7 delimeters and escape character,

        "It's ~20 lbs & 3 oz" &rarr; "It's \R\20 lbs \T\ 3 oz"
        Parameters:
        s - string to escape
        Returns:
        escaped string

      • unescape

        public java.lang.String unescape(java.lang.String s)
        Unescapes text given the separators and escape character in this HL7Params instance.

        For instance, given the default HL7 delimeters and escape character,

        "It's \R\20 lbs \T\ 3 oz" &rarr; "It's ~20 lbs & 3 oz"
        Parameters:
        s - string to unescape
        Returns:
        unescaped string
